title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Diego H.. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to tidygeoboundaries
text: outlines propose change tidygeoboundaries. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to tidygeoboundaries
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to tidygeoboundaries
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to tidygeoboundaries
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("dieghernan/tidygeoboundaries", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to tidygeoboundaries
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to tidygeoboundaries
text: Please note tidygeoboundaries project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: Clear your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
title: Clear your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
text: Use function caution. function clear cached data configuration, specifically: Deletes tidygeoboundaries config directory (rappdirs::user_config_dir("tidygeobn", "R")). Deletes cache_dir directory. Deletes values stored Sys.getenv("GEOBN_CACHE_DIR") options(mapSpain_cache_dir).

title: Clear your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
code: geobn_clear_cache(config = FALSE, cached_data = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Clear your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
text: config Logical. TRUE, delete configuration folder tidygeoboundaries. cached_data Logical. TRUE, delete cache_dir content. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE.

title: Clear your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_clear_cache

what: Detect cache dir for tidygeoboundaries — geobn_detect_cache_dir
title: Detect cache dir for tidygeoboundaries — geobn_detect_cache_dir
text: Helper function detect current cache folder. See geobn_set_cache_dir().

title: Detect cache dir for tidygeoboundaries — geobn_detect_cache_dir

what: Set your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
title: Set your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
text: function store cache_dir path local machine load future sessions. Type Sys.getenv("GEOBN_CACHE_DIR") find cached path. Alternatively, can store cache_dir manually following options: Run Sys.setenv(GEOBN_CACHE_DIR = "cache_dir"). need run command session (Similar install = FALSE). Write line .Renviron file: GEOBN_CACHE_DIR = "value_for_cache_dir" (behavior install = TRUE). store cache_dir permanently.

title: Set your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
code: geobn_set_cache_dir(   cache_dir,   overwrite = FALSE,   install = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Set your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
text: cache_dir path cache directory. missing value function store cached files temporary dir (See base::tempdir()). overwrite Logical. set TRUE, overwrite existing GEOBN_CACHE_DIR already local machine. install Logical. TRUE, install key local machine use future sessions.  Defaults FALSE. cache_dir FALSE parameter set FALSE automatically. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE.

title: Set your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
text: (invisible) character path cache_dir.

title: Set your tidygeoboundaries cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
code: # Don't run this! It would modify your current state if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ geobn_set_cache_dir(verbose = TRUE) } # }  Sys.getenv("GEOBN_CACHE_DIR") #> [1] "C:\\Users\\RUNNER~1\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpeMNVLS/tidygeobn"

title: Get geoBoundaries data — get_geobn
text: Return spatial object using sf.

title: Get geoBoundaries data — get_geobn
code: get_geobn(   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   country,   boundary_type = c("ADM0", "ADM1", "ADM2", "ADM3", "ADM4", "ALL"),   simplified = FALSE,   metadata = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   update_cache = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )

title: Get geoBoundaries data — get_geobn
text: release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"`. Source spatial data. See Details. country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names vector ISO3 country codes. Mixed types (c("Italy","ES","FRA")) work. See also countrycode::countrycode(). boundary_type Type boundary Accepted values "" (available boundaries) ADM level ("ADM0" country boundary, "ADM1" first level sub national boundaries, "ADM2" second level . simplified Logical. Return simplified boundary . metadata result metadata boundary? See Details. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE. update_cache logical whether update cache. Default FALSE. set TRUE force fresh download source .geojson file. cache_dir path cache directory. See geobn_set_cache_dir().

title: Get geoBoundaries data — get_geobn
text: metadata = FALSE: sf object, otherwise tibble.

what: tidygeoboundaries: Download Map Data from Geoboundaries — tidygeoboundaries-package
title: tidygeoboundaries: Download Map Data from Geoboundaries — tidygeoboundaries-package
text: Tools download data geoboundaries https://www.geoboundaries.org/. Several administration levels available. See Runfola, D. et al. (2020) geoBoundaries: global database political administrative boundaries. PLoS ONE 15(4): e0231866. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0231866 .

title: tidygeoboundaries: Download Map Data from Geoboundaries — tidygeoboundaries-package
text: Maintainer: Diego Hernangómez diego.hernangomezherrero@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

text: Initial CRAN submission.
